title: ISic030002
support: Upper right fragment of a lamina, probably nailed to the wall of a building (perhaps a temple). A trace of this operation can be read in the damage in the upper margin between the seventh and eighth letters of the first line of writing.

date._: 525—500 BCE, based on palaeographic features. Previous editors dating: post 491 - ante 485; Manganaro: 450 ca.

provenanceFound._: Found in the area of Acrae.
